TITLE: Toggle Breakpoint in Neovim with nvim-dap (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the nvim-dap plugin to toggle a breakpoint at the current line in Neovim. It calls the `toggle_breakpoint()` function from the `dap` module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Lua
CODE:
```
:lua require'dap'.toggle_breakpoint()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Key Mappings for Debugging
DESCRIPTION: This Lua snippet provides example key mappings for common debugging actions in nvim-dap. It uses `vim.keymap.set` to bind keys to functions like continuing, stepping over, stepping into, stepping out, toggling breakpoints, setting log points, opening the REPL, running the last debug session, and showing hover/preview information. It includes mappings for both normal and visual modes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
vim.keymap.set('n', '<F5>', function() require('dap').continue() end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<F10>', function() require('dap').step_over() end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<F11>', function() require('dap').step_into() end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<F12>', function() require('dap').step_out() end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>b', function() require('dap').toggle_breakpoint() end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>B', function() require('dap').set_breakpoint() end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>lp', function() require('dap').set_breakpoint(nil, nil, vim.fn.input('Log point message: ')) end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>dr', function() require('dap').repl.open() end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>dl', function() require('dap').run_last() end)
vim.keymap.set({'n', 'v'}, '<Leader>dh', function()
  require('dap.ui.widgets').hover()
end)
vim.keymap.set({'n', 'v'}, '<Leader>dp', function()
  require('dap.ui.widgets').preview()
end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>df', function()
  local widgets = require('dap.ui.widgets')
  widgets.centered_float(widgets.frames)
end)
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>ds', function()
  local widgets = require('dap.ui.widgets')
  widgets.centered_float(widgets.scopes)
end)
```

TITLE: Example launch.json with Basic Configurations
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet provides an example of a `launch.json` file with two basic debug configurations: one for Java and another for C++. Each configuration specifies the 'type', 'request', and 'name' properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "type": "java",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch Java"
    },
    {
      "type": "cppdbg",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch CPP"
    }
  ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Launch Configuration (Partial)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a partial launch configuration with `request`, `name`, and `program` properties. Note the use of `${file}` to represent the active file name, and the `pythonPath` property set to a function that returns the path to the python interpreter. This snippet is part of a larger launch configuration example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
request = 'launch';
name = "Launch file";
program = "${file}";
pythonPath = function()
  return '/usr/bin/python'
end;
```

TITLE: Continue Execution in Neovim with nvim-dap (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the nvim-dap plugin to continue the execution of the debugging session. It calls the `continue()` function from the `dap` module to resume the program execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Lua
CODE:
```
:lua require'dap'.continue()
```

TITLE: launch.json with OS-Specific Properties
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet illustrates how to define system-specific properties within a `launch.json` file using 'linux', 'osx', and 'windows' sub-objects.  Each sub-object contains properties that override the base properties when running on the corresponding operating system.  This example configures the debugger path for cppdbg on different platforms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "cppdbg",
  "request": "launch",
  "name": "Launch CPP",
  "linux": {
    "MIMode": "gdb",
    "miDebuggerPath": "/usr/bin/gdb"
  },
  "osx": {
    "MIMode": "lldb",
    "miDebuggerPath": "/usr/local/bin/lldb-mi"
  },
  "windows": {
    "MIMode": "gdb",
    "miDebuggerPath": "C:\\MinGw\\bin\\gdb.exe"
  }
}
```

TITLE: Registering a Debug Adapter
DESCRIPTION: Registers the `debugpy` debug adapter for Python under the type `python`. It specifies the command to execute to launch the debug adapter, along with any necessary arguments. The command uses the environment variable `HOME` to find the Python executable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local dap = require('dap')
dap.adapters.python = {
  type = 'executable';
  command = os.getenv('HOME') .. '/.virtualenvs/tools/bin/python';
  args = { '-m', 'debugpy.adapter' };
}
```

TITLE: Step Over in Neovim with nvim-dap (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the nvim-dap plugin to step over the current line of code during a debugging session.  It calls the `step_over()` function from the `dap` module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Lua
CODE:
```
:lua require'dap'.step_over()
```

TITLE: Sending a Request to the Debug Adapter
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to send a request to the debug adapter using `session:request`, providing a callback function to handle the result.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_43

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local session = assert(require("dap").session(), "has active session")
local arguments = {
  expression = "1 + 2"
}
---@param err dap.ErrorResponse
---@param result dap.EvaluateResponse
local function on_result(err, result)
  vim.print(err or "No error")
  vim.print(result or "No result")
end
session:request("evaluate", arguments, on_result)
```

TITLE: Step Into in Neovim with nvim-dap (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the nvim-dap plugin to step into a function call during a debugging session. It calls the `step_into()` function from the `dap` module to move into the called function's code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Lua
CODE:
```
:lua require'dap'.step_into()
```

TITLE: Open REPL in Neovim with nvim-dap (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the nvim-dap plugin to open the built-in REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop) for inspecting the state of the application during debugging. It calls the `repl.open()` function from the `dap` module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Lua
CODE:
```
:lua require'dap'.repl.open()
```

TITLE: Lua Function to Abort Debug Session
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to use a Lua function within a launch configuration to prompt the user for a path and abort the debug session if no path is provided. `dap.ABORT` is returned to signal that the debug session should not start.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
program = function()
  local path = vim.fn.input({
    prompt = 'Path to executable: ',
    default = vim.fn.getcwd() .. '/',
    completion = 'file'
  })
  return (path and path ~= "") and path or dap.ABORT
end
```

TITLE: launch.json with Input Placeholder
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet demonstrates the use of input placeholders in `launch.json` to prompt the user for input. It defines an input with the id 'myPrompt' of type 'pickString' and uses it in the 'program' property of the launch configuration.  The user will be prompted to select the program to run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "type": "python",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch",
      "program": "${input:myPrompt}"
    }
  ],
  "inputs": [
    {
      "id": "myPrompt",
      "type": "pickString",
      "description": "Program to run: ",
      "default": "foobar"
    }
  ]
}
```

TITLE: Adapter Configuration Function
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting `dap.adapters.<name>` to a function which defers the resolving of the adapter configuration until a configuration is used. This example starts a java-debug adapter asynchronously using an external command to retrieve the port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
dap.adapters.java = function(callback, config)
  M.execute_command({command = 'vscode.java.startDebugSession'}, function(err0, port)
    assert(not err0, vim.inspect(err0))
    callback({ type = 'server'; host = '127.0.0.1'; port = port; })
  end)
end
```

TITLE: Customizing Signs with sign_define()
DESCRIPTION: This Lua snippet demonstrates how to customize the signs used by nvim-dap to represent breakpoints, log points, and other debugging states. It uses the `vim.fn.sign_define()` function to modify the appearance of the 'DapBreakpoint' sign, setting the text, text highlight, line highlight, and number highlight.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
vim.fn.sign_define('DapBreakpoint', {text='ðŸ›‘', texthl='', linehl='', numhl=''})
```

TITLE: Using nvim-dap widgets to view frames in sidebar (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use nvim-dap widgets to create a sidebar that displays the current frames during a debugging session. It requires the `dap.ui.widgets` module. The `open()` method displays the sidebar.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  local widgets = require('dap.ui.widgets')
  local my_sidebar = widgets.sidebar(widgets.frames)
  my_sidebar.open()
```

TITLE: Using nvim-dap widgets to view scopes in floating window (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to display the current scopes in a centered floating window using nvim-dap widgets.  It requires the `dap.ui.widgets` module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  local widgets = require('dap.ui.widgets')
  widgets.centered_float(widgets.scopes)
```

DESCRIPTION: Example of a debuggee configuration for Python. It demonstrates how to set the `type`, `request`, and `name` properties, which are required for any debug configuration. The configuration is stored under the `python` filetype.

```
local dap = require('dap')
dap.configurations.python = {

```

TITLE: Setting Exception Breakpoints in Lua
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the `set_exception_breakpoints` function in nvim-dap to configure when the debugger should break on exceptions. It shows different ways to specify exception filters, including using default settings, specifying individual exception types, and using fallback tables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
-- Ask user to stop on which kinds of exceptions
require'dap'.set_exception_breakpoints()
-- don't stop on exceptions
require'dap'.set_exception_breakpoints({})
-- stop only on certain exceptions (debugpy offers "raised", "uncaught")
require'dap'.set_exception_breakpoints({"uncaughted"})
require'dap'.set_exception_breakpoints({"raised", "uncaught"})
-- use default settings of debug adapter
require'dap'.set_exception_breakpoints("default")
```

TITLE: Using nvim-dap widgets to hover and view expression value (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to display the value of the expression under the cursor in a floating window using nvim-dap widgets. It requires the `dap.ui.widgets` module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_33

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  require('dap.ui.widgets').hover()
```

TITLE: Extending REPL Commands in Lua
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to extend the built-in REPL commands in nvim-dap. It shows how to add new aliases for existing commands and how to define custom commands that can be invoked from the REPL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local repl = require 'dap.repl'
repl.commands = vim.tbl_extend('force', repl.commands, {
  -- Add a new alias for the existing .exit command
  exit = {'exit', '.exit', '.bye'},
  -- Add your own commands; run `.echo hello world` to invoke
  -- this function with the text "hello world"
  custom_commands = {
    ['.echo'] = function(text)
      dap.repl.append(text)
    end,
    -- Hook up a new command to an existing dap function
    ['.restart'] = dap.restart,
  },
}
)
```

TITLE: External Terminal Configuration - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Configures nvim-dap to launch an external terminal for debugging. It specifies the command and arguments required to launch the desired terminal application (e.g., Alacritty). This setup requires a terminal emulator to be available and configured correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local dap = require('dap')
dap.defaults.fallback.external_terminal = {
  command = '/usr/bin/alacritty';
  args = {'-e'};
}
```

TITLE: Registering a configuration provider (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to register a config provider which is called by nvim-dap to get a suitable |dap-configuration| to use. The key for the table is a plugin-id. The value is a function that takes a buffer number as parameter and must return |dap-configuration| entries as a list.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  local dap = require("dap")
  dap.providers.configs["mydummy_provider"] = function(bufnr)
    return {
      {
        name = "This config always shows up",
        type = "gdb",
        request = "launch",
        program = "/usr/bin/zig",
        args = {"run", "${file}"},
        cwd = "${workspaceFolder}",
      },
    }
  end
```

TITLE: Picking a Process with Filter (function)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use `dap.utils.pick_process` to display a prompt for selecting a process, filtering the processes by name using a Lua function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_39

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require("dap.utils").pick_process({
  filter = function(proc) return vim.endswith(proc.name, "sway") end
})
```

TITLE: Picking a File with Filter (string)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use `dap.utils.pick_file` to display a prompt for selecting a file, filtering the files by name using a string pattern and disabling executable-only filtering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_40

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require("dap.utils").pick_file({ filter = ".*%.py", executables = false })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Picking a File with Filter (function)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use `dap.utils.pick_file` to display a prompt for selecting a file, filtering the files by name using a Lua function and disabling executable-only filtering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_41

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require("dap.utils").pick_file({
  executables = false,
  filter = function(filepath)
    return vim.endswith(filepath, ".py")
  end,
})
```

TITLE: Customize Integrated Terminal Command - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Configures the command used to create a split window for the integrated terminal in nvim-dap. This allows for customizing the terminal's layout and size within Neovim's UI. The example uses '50vsplit new' to create a vertical split occupying 50% of the available space.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local dap = require('dap')
dap.defaults.fallback.terminal_win_cmd = '50vsplit new'
```

TITLE: Global Terminal Configuration - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Sets a global terminal command for all debug adapters in nvim-dap, then overrides it for python. This configuration uses 'tabnew' for all adapters and 'belowright new' for python. This example showcases how to configure a generic debugging terminal and apply customizations for specific debugging adapters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local dap = require('dap')
-- Use "tabnew" for all debug adapters
dap.defaults.fallback.terminal_win_cmd = 'tabnew'
-- Except for python
dap.defaults.python.terminal_win_cmd = 'belowright new'
```

TITLE: Output Event Handling Customization - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Overrides the default output handling in nvim-dap with a custom handler. This allows for ignoring or modifying output events based on custom logic. It demonstrates how to intercept `output_event` and `session` parameters to implement custom handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
---@param session dap.Session
---@param output_event dap.OutputEvent
dap.defaults.fallback.on_output = function(session, output_event)
  -- ignore all outputs
end
```

TITLE: Lua Function as Launch Configuration Value
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use a Lua function to dynamically determine the value of a property in a launch configuration.  The function returns a coroutine which suspends and uses `vim.ui.select` to prompt the user for input, then resumes the `dap_run_co` with the chosen value.  This example demonstrates asynchronous operation during debug configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
foo = function()
  return coroutine.create(function(dap_run_co)
    local items = {'one', 'two'}
    vim.ui.select(items, { label = 'foo> '}, function(choice)
      coroutine.resume(dap_run_co, choice)
    end)
  end)
end
```

TITLE: Registering a listener for the 'terminated' event (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to register a listener function that is called before the internal nvim-dap handlers for the `event_terminated` event. The listener prints a message when a session is terminated. It requires the `dap` module. `session` and `body` contain the session and event payload respectively.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  local dap = require('dap')
  dap.listeners.before['event_terminated']['my-plugin'] = function(session, body)
    print('Session terminated', vim.inspect(session), vim.inspect(body))
  end
```

TITLE: Registering an 'on_config' hook (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to register a function to pre-process the |dap-configuration| when a debug session starts. The key for the table is a plugin-id. The value is a function that takes and returns a |dap-configuration|.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  local dap = require("dap")
  dap.listeners.on_config["dummy-noop"] = function(config)
    return vim.deepcopy(config)
  end
```

TITLE: Overriding JSON Decode Function with json5 Parser
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to override the default JSON decoding function in nvim-dap to use a json5 parser. This allows the use of json5 features like trailing commas in launch.json files. It requires a 3rd-party json5 parser to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require('dap.ext.vscode').json_decode = require'json5'.parse
```

TITLE: Adapter Configuration with Enrich Config
DESCRIPTION: Example of adapter configuration using the `enrich_config` property. This property is a function that allows an adapter to enrich a configuration with additional information dynamically before the debug session starts. In this case, it injects an `extra_property` into the configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local adapter = {
  type = 'server';
  host = '127.0.0.1';
  port = 8080;
  enrich_config = function(config, on_config)
    local final_config = vim.deepcopy(config)
    final_config.extra_property = 'This got injected by the adapter'
    on_config(final_config)
  end;
}
```

TITLE: Setting Default Exception Breakpoints via Fallback in Lua
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure default exception breakpoints using the `defaults.fallback` table in nvim-dap. This allows you to specify a global default for exception breakpoints that will be used if no other configuration is specified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require('dap').defaults.fallback.exception_breakpoints = {'raised'}
```

TITLE: Setting Exception Breakpoints per Adapter Type in Lua
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to configure exception breakpoints for a specific adapter type in nvim-dap. This allows you to customize exception breakpoint behavior based on the debugger being used (e.g., 'python').
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: lua

```
require('dap').defaults.python.exception_breakpoints = {'raised'}
```

TITLE: Disable auto-continue for Java - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Disables the auto-continue behavior for Java debugging sessions within nvim-dap. Setting `auto_continue_if_many_stopped` to `false` is useful in multithreaded applications where multiple threads may stop simultaneously, ensuring the debugger doesn't automatically resume a thread when another is already stopped.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
dap.defaults.java.auto_continue_if_many_stopped = false
```

TITLE: Force External Terminal - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Forces nvim-dap to use an external terminal for debugging, even if the debug adapter doesn't provide an option to choose between internal and external terminals. This configuration overrides the adapter's default behavior and always launches the debugee in a separate terminal window.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local dap = require('dap')
dap.defaults.fallback.force_external_terminal = true
```

TITLE: Focus Terminal Configuration - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Configures nvim-dap to shift focus to the integrated terminal when it opens. This ensures that the terminal receives immediate focus after it's created, allowing for direct interaction with the debugee's output and input. By default, focus remains on the current buffer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local dap = require('dap')
dap.defaults.fallback.focus_terminal = true
```

TITLE: Setting Log Level in Lua
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the log level for nvim-dap.  It sets the log level to 'TRACE', providing the most verbose logging output.  The log file is located in the `cache` folder within the standard path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require('dap').set_log_level('TRACE')
```

TITLE: Set autostart configuration - Lua
DESCRIPTION: Sets the name of a debug configuration to autostart when evaluating an expression in the REPL without an active session. This simplifies debugging by automatically starting the specified configuration (e.g., 'nluarepl') when needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
dap.defaults.fallback.autostart = "nluarepl"
```

TITLE: Using nvim-dap widgets to view scopes in sidebar (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use nvim-dap widgets to create a sidebar that displays the current scopes during a debugging session. It requires the `dap.ui.widgets` module.  The `open()` method displays the sidebar.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  local widgets = require('dap.ui.widgets')
  local my_sidebar = widgets.sidebar(widgets.scopes)
  my_sidebar.open()
```

TITLE: Customizing buffer and window creation with nvim-dap widgets (Lua)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to customize the buffer and window creation using the low-level builder of nvim-dap widgets. It requires the `dap.ui.widgets` module, and provides functions that create and return a buffer and a window, respectively.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_34

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
  local widgets = require('dap.ui.widgets')
  widgets.builder(widgets.scopes)
    .new_buf(function_that_creates_and_returns_a_buffer)
    .new_win(function_that_creates_and_returns_a_window)
    .build()
```

TITLE: Sending a Request with Coroutine
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to send a request to the debug adapter using `session:request` within a coroutine, eliminating the need for a callback function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_44

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
local session = assert(require("dap").session(), "has active session")
local arguments = {
  expression = "1 + 2"
}
coroutine.wrap(function()
  local err, result = session:request("evaluate", arguments)
  vim.print(err or "No error")
  vim.print(result or "No result")
end)()
```

TITLE: Splitting a String
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to split a string on whitespace using `dap.utils.splitstr`, handling quoted strings correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_42

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require("dap.utils").splitstr("Hello world")
-- result: {"Hello", "world"}

require("dap.utils").splitstr("Keeps 'a quoted string' intact")
-- result: {"Keeps", "a quoted string", "intact"}
```

TITLE: Attaching Autocompletion to REPL Buffer
DESCRIPTION: This vimscript snippet demonstrates how to automatically attach the nvim-dap autocompletion functionality to the REPL buffer. This is achieved by using an autocommand that triggers when a file with the `dap-repl` filetype is opened, which then calls the `require('dap.ext.autocompl').attach()` function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mfussenegger/nvim-dap/blob/master/doc/dap.txt#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: vim
CODE:
```
au FileType dap-repl lua require('dap.ext.autocompl').attach()
```
